name: Garudayana Mythology
description:
This artwork was inspired by one of Hindu old folktale titled 'Garudayana'.

The folktale itself is about the archrival relationship between Garuda and Naga.

Which is in this folktale, there's alot of moral value that we can learn from both Garuda and Naga about their brave heart, an optimistic mind, and a faithful bond of their spiritual responsibility.

But the most interesting part of this archrival relationship to be told is when i realized that the folktale were offering us a precious moral value about how to control our mind and our righteous concept in the middle of human social life.

It is to make us realized that how often we were being trapped by our version of the 'right things to do', then we became intolerances everytime we see any differences things around, even know we ride on the same train with the same directions.
Which is basically the concept itself has too many relatives possibility from one person into another, that we ussualy called as 'tolerances in differences'
